title: Ciclovia & Cicolruta Programs
description: Reduced crime, improved health & social cohesion

title: Copenhagen Citywide Bicycle Infrastructure
description: 49% of all commutes are by bike, annual savings of $44 million in health costs

title: New York Times Square Pedestrianization
description: 71% increase in retail sales, 40% reduction in pedestrian injuries

title: Mumbai Public Toilet Initiative
description: 1.5 million users. Reduction in sanitation-related illnesses

title: Vienna Active Transportation Campaigns
description: 30% increase in daily walking and cycling trips. Reduction in obesity rates by 5%.

title: Tokyo Urban Greening and Park Development
description: Improved mental health indicators among residents, with a reported 20% reduction in stress levels.

title: New York City Green Cart Initiative
description: Decrease in diet-related illnesses such as diabetes and hypertension.

title: Seoul Health Monitoring Stations
description: Over 1 million users annually. Early detection of chronic illnesses in 15% of users, leading to timely medical intervention.

title: Barcelona Urban Walking Routes
description: 25% increase in daily walking trips. Reduced incidence of heart disease and obesity

title: Amsterdam Smoke-Free Zones in Public Areas
description: Reduced exposure to secondhand smoke for children and decrease in smoking-related litter

title: London Low Emission Zone
description: Decrease in respiratory and cardiovascular hospital admissions by 8%.
